comment: She gave me a D for a presentation which was well put together. She stated I was reading off of my notes. I looked down one time and right back up. I looked at the camera the entire time. She brought the grade up to a B but the damage was done. My whole class was reporting her to the psych board but I didn't. Smh. I didn't care for her after that.

HORRIBLE PROFESSOR! She will single you out in front of the entire class and makes you speak on very sensitive topics. She interrupts you during presentations, does not even let you finish what you're saying. Every discussion post is based on opinion. She also does not stick to test dates and everything is very up in the air.

I had to drop this course due to the professor never putting in grades. We were 3 months into class and I did not have a single grade in D2L. She talks about some very controversial topics and makes you speak on the topics despite being uncomfortable. She is also a very tough grader.
This professor was terrible. She will interrupt you in the middle of your presentation and does not care about calling you out. Very hard grader as well no matter how hard you work on something.
I would not recommend taking this professor for this course at all. She is very bad at responding to emails. She also grades very hard no matter how much effort you put I to your work.
I would not recommend taking this professor. She makes the class than harder than it supposed to be. She don't    like to take feedback as well.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Do not take this professor. She is very insensitive and does not care about the work load in this course. She does not respond to emails either when asking for help. I do not recommend.

I wouldn't recommend the professor. The class is easy, she makes it difficult. Everyone should leave the class with an A because it requires minimum effort but she grades difficult and requires attendance.

Professor Pearson herself was sweet and not an evil professor by anymeans. However there are only 4 quizzes and a final. She refuses to release overall course grades and the final was very vaugely described. Grading rubrics are basically non-existant and just about everything (participation, discussion posts, etc.) is graded on persoanl opinion.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: If you engage and participate in the discussions as well as read the chapters you will do fine. It is a lot of reading but it is relevant and interesting content. Her quizzes can be quite tricky as well. Learn how to eliminate incorrect answers and pay attention.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: AMAZING PROFESSOR. Well respected. Down to earth. Relatable subject matter. She is very understanding if you let her know whats going on. There are 4 quizzes. 2 group projects. & 1 paper. I would take her again if I could. Be prepared to read & she lets you have 2 unexcused absences without affecting your grade. TAKE HER!!!

Dr. Pearson is overall a nice professor I would not recommend taking her for 2.5hrs however.  We read a lot in class and it was driven by student participation. Furthermore, there are 4 "test"quizzes she says and they are very specific to the reading. Get ready for group projects , there is even a role play. She grades hard on those group projects.

I learned so many things from this class that will definitely help me in my future endeavors. There are four quizzes and they are hard, but if you read you will do well. She is very approachable and understanding, so don't be afraid to ask questions. The class is based on participation, which isn't bad due to the interesting topics.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Worse professor I have ever had!DO NOT TAKE HER IF YOU CAN!!! Class is easy, but she makes it difficult. She gives quizzes with 7-8 answer choices. For example, A, B , C, D, E, AB,DA,ABC.. She posted all of our grades on the last day of class (when we took our final exam). We had to talk to the chair of the department because she made up our grade.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She's a likeable person but a terrible professor. You get graded on 4 quizzes (20 MC) - no tests. 2 group presentations, and 1 paper. Quiz 1 had an entire chapter that she crammed in 10 min right before it. Quiz 2 was over 8-9 chapters. People who have given their presentations a month ago still don't have grades - she said her computer is broken.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: The class is very opinion driven; everyone can say what they believe. My only complaint would be that I wish it was more informative.  She does not give out test just "quizzes" they are more like test. Be ready for group presentations! It is a great class overall.
